within: containment algorithms such as point in polygon


Functions

template<typename P1 , typename P2 , template< typename, typename > class VP, template< typename, typename > class VR, template< typename > class AP, template< typename > class AR, typename S >
bool geometry::within (const P1 &p, const polygon< P2, VP, VR, AP, AR > &poly, const S &strategy)
 Examine if point is in polygon.
template<typename P1 , typename P2 , template< typename, typename > class VP, template< typename, typename > class VR, template< typename > class AP, template< typename > class AR>
bool geometry::within (const P1 &p, const polygon< P2, VP, VR, AP, AR > &poly)
 Examine if point is in polygon.

Detailed Description

The within algorithm checks if one geometry is located completely within another geometry. A well-known example is point-in-polygon, returning true if a point falls within a polygon. Many point-in-polygon algorithms ignore boundary cases (point is situated on boundary of polygon), however the within_point_in_polygon method should return true if a point is completely within the boundary of the polygon, and not on the boundary.

Function Documentation

template<typename P1 , typename P2 , template< typename, typename > class VP, template< typename, typename > class VR, template< typename > class AP, template< typename > class AR, typename S >
bool geometry::within ( const P1 &  p,
const polygon< P2, VP, VR, AP, AR > &  poly,
const S &  strategy 
)

Examine if point is in polygon.

The function within, for point-polygon, returns the point lies within the polygon, using a specified strategy

Parameters:
p point to examine
poly polygon to examine
strategy optional strategy to be used for within detection. If not specified, the default within-detection strategy is taken.
Returns:
true if point is within the polygon, else false
Example:
Example showing how to use within using a strategy 
{
        // TO BE UPDATED/FINISHED
        typedef geometry::point_xy<double> P;
        typedef geometry::polygon<P> POLY;
        P p;
        std::cout << within(p, poly, strategy::within::cross_count<P>) << std::endl;
}
Note:
The strategy bound by the specialized strategy_traits class is used for within detection

template<typename P1 , typename P2 , template< typename, typename > class VP, template< typename, typename > class VR, template< typename > class AP, template< typename > class AR>
bool geometry::within ( const P1 &  p,
const polygon< P2, VP, VR, AP, AR > &  poly 
)

Examine if point is in polygon.

The function within, for point-polygon, returns the point lies completely within the polygon

Parameters:
p point to examine
poly polygon to examine
Returns:
true if point is completely contained within the polygon, else false
Example:
The within algorithm is used as following: 
{
        geometry::polygon<geometry::point_xy<double> > poly;
        geometry::from_wkt("POLYGON((0 0,0 7,4 2,2 0,0 0))", poly);
        geometry::point_xy<float> point(3, 3);
        std::cout << "Point is "
                << (geometry::within(point, poly) ? "IN" : "NOT in")
                << " polygon"
                << std::endl;
}
Note:
The strategy bound by the specialized strategy_traits class is used for within detection
